topic.title: Anyone using Yacy?
topic.body: Been playing around with that as well. Looking for any hints on how to make it faster and better.

topic.title: Zeronet - connected sites question
topic.body: How long does it take for the connected sites to drop off or do I have to manually delete the ones I dont care about manually?

topic.title: Ported the best podcast in the universe (self-proclaimed) - NoAgendaShow.bit

27_1H5UJ7LneToGqYqJ9fbLnu1Ko2pxTpchof.body: I would assume no, but cannot confirm

1_1EMDKkZzS2ztrvcsUmzFkifjMWKFu73zCs.body:
> [amuza](#comment_9_1NF9DMeY1kNvm7yNDcxkVgZ2Y9Jc893bgA): I find it very interesting. It just requires people to crawl sites to contribute to the global index.

Same here. My hugest problem was even with my SSD it would lock up the machine once the ram was full and it would parse to the swap. In any case they need LOADS of performance tweaks and possibly a full reprogram. Neat idea though.

15049_1KbV1e1u6P6AsY8XNBydgtbtN8iSB5WMyG.body: You would really think people would learn. You are never 'truly' anonymous and when you are its only a matter of time until you are tracked. #morons

3_1DFDjUGJdSp1kMuFq1AtNS9ZWmkVtbp947.body: Try another browser perhaps? Ive had similar issues with just bad 'code' and another browser would work. Worth a shot

8_14UupgrdnT7Y8vMES7aqUFgD1fC5RYNrh8.body:
> [james007](#comment_57_1DiRWRFXcVgQQ75cXnAG2pyxxjGo2VaH5): HORNET, but it was never completed. Tor has actually gotten a LOT faster than it was in the past, mostly due to high speed relays and exits.

Yea provided by the feds no doubt. Thats the way actually track joker on Tor, via the exit nodes. To me TOR is just a farse.

2_1EMDKkZzS2ztrvcsUmzFkifjMWKFu73zCs.body:
> [james007](#comment_59_1DiRWRFXcVgQQ75cXnAG2pyxxjGo2VaH5): As far as I know they stay there forever until you delete them. Even if you to delete them, they will stay as long as there are peers.  [...]

Interesting. The UI needs to be rewritten to hide all that then and have them auto drop after 6 months for example. Pretty needless to have them sit there and report for no reason. (Yes I know the reason but for end users its pointless work) Good too know, thanks

15188_1KbV1e1u6P6AsY8XNBydgtbtN8iSB5WMyG.body: I enjoy making paper wallets myself. Why would this be worth the cost?

4_1EMDKkZzS2ztrvcsUmzFkifjMWKFu73zCs.body:
> [xianc78](#comment_13_141zS75MupoDVjN4p7ivG9pXUXjAm9jLBQ): What's it about?

They do 'media assasination' on the current news. Basically the play a bunch of clips from the news that are from the mainstream and make zero sense and try to figure out what they really mean. Also, they stay pretty unbias so its a great listen no matter your politics.

15212_1KbV1e1u6P6AsY8XNBydgtbtN8iSB5WMyG.body: They should really call it "Ghetto trading" sites considering the "dark web" is simply nothing indexed by search engines. When you call it like it is, well, to me its more - good riddance. No one needs that scum around.

9_13aB79mzuRLgDYzQthn9wzycjw77WyDXh6.body:
> [nofish](#comment_1023_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): I'm afraid it's not possible due iframe sandboxing limitations

Which is a plus. The intent is to move sites to Zeronet, not simply mirror

1_1QLCGgg1exQCF1YW2cAHzm9NUyLjXLDoww.body: Welcome, over to your right are the hookers and booze. To your left, mutton and mead. ITM mofo.

15252_1KbV1e1u6P6AsY8XNBydgtbtN8iSB5WMyG.body: Everyone is full of shit. Would love to explain away shit I cant explain and toss some label on it. "Sorry boss, can't figure out that DB rewrite, must be the 'DARK WEB'!"

1_14tnrN3dbjc7t5ZbRxT2Vi8CbC4uoqZrFh.body: Well once I learn chinese, or mandarin, or japenese, I will be all over this!

1510279908_16oMvhMrWnKi271dR6fyRuG6XV7Uw.body: akito: yes, a thousand way to do one thing. Noted
